title.narrative: Second Public Financial Management Capacity Strengthening Project

description.narrative: The development objective of the Second Public Financial Management (PFM) Capacity Strengthening Project for Somalia is to establish and strengthen institutional capacity for the management of public funds in central finance agencies and targeted sectors. The project comprises of six components. The first component, revenue mobilization, planning, and budget preparation consists of following two sub-components: (i) strengthening planning and budget preparation; and (ii) revenue mobilization and tax administration. The second component, treasury management, budget execution, procurement, accounting, and financial reporting consists of following five sub-components: (i) treasury management and budget execution; (ii) accounting and financial reporting; (iii) concessions, procurement, and contract management; (iv) bespoke financial management information systems (FMIS); and (v) modernizing Central Bank of Somalia banking operations and financial control environment. The third component, strengthening the integrity pillars consists of following two sub-components: (i) foundations for supreme audit institutions (SAI); and (ii) planning, finance, and public accounts committee (PAC). The fourth component, PFM professionalization will build capacity at the individual level for planning and budget preparation officials, procurement officers, accountants, and internal and external auditors to obtain the required capability knowledge, skills, abilities, and other characteristics (values, integrity etc.). The fifth component, PFM oversight, coordination, and management will anchor the reform and capacity building efforts. The sixth component, demand-driven just-in-time services (Bank Executed) will be implemented by the Bank on behalf of the beneficiaries according to paragraph (12)(d) of the Bank's operating policy (OP) 10.00 due to insufficient capacity by the beneficiaries to u

condition.narrative: Schedule 2 Section I B1: The Recipient shall: not later than thirty (30) days after the Signature Date, update the ProjectImplementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the World Bank.

Schedule 2 Section I.C.1: The Recipient shall not later than thirty (30) days after the Signature Date, update the ProjectImplementation Manual, in form and substance satisfactory to the World Bank, and thereafter.

baseline.value: Ad hoc approach to revenue mobilization

target.value: Procedures manual for tax administration disseminated and training conducted

title.narrative: PSS - Improved Information contained in annual financial reports

baseline.value: Revenue Expenditure reports by organizational and economic classification

target.value: Donor funds under the control of the government and register for moveable fixed assets included

actual.value: Not implemented - Donor funds under the control of the government not included

title.narrative: FGS - Improved information contained in annual financial reports

baseline.value: Revenue and Expenditure reports by organizational and economic classification

target.value: Donor funds under the control of government and Register for moveable fixed assets included

actual.value: Not achieved - Donor funds under the control of the government not included

title.narrative: SOMALILAND - Improved information contained in annual financial reports

baseline.value: Revenue and Expenditure reports by organizational and economic classification

target.value: Donor funds under the control of the government and register for moveable fixed assets included

actual.value: achieved - Annual Financial Statements submitted in timely manner with coverage including revenue, expenditures, financial assets,domestic arrears and cash flow statement; as well as donor funds under the control of the government

title.narrative: Revenue instruments (both tax and non-tax) with basic processes automated at the FGS.

baseline.value: Audit procedure and methodology not aligned with INTOSAI standards

target.value: (i) Improved regularity audit methods applied for Government Financial Statement Audits (FGS & SL); (ii) Percentage of MDAs withaudited financial statements using Audit Management Software and adopting improved methodology (PL)

actual.value: Implemented - As of 2019, the OAG is progressively adopting Compliance Audit Manual (CAM) & Financial Audit Manual (FAM) that weredeveloped with technical assistance of the INTOSAI Development Institute (IDI). These were developed based on INTOSAI standards.

baseline.value: Audit procedures & methodology not aligned with INTOSAI Standards (FGS, PL,SL)

target.value: (I) Improved regularity audit methods applied for Government Financial Statement Audits (FGS and SL)(II) Percentage of MDAs withaudited financial statements using Audit Management Software & adopting improved methodology (Puntland)

baseline.value: Audit procedures and methodology not aligned with INTOSAI standards

target.value: (i) Improved regularity audit methods applied for government financial statement audits (FGS AND SL); and (ii) Percentage of MDAswith audited financial statements using Audit management software and adopting improved methodology (PL)

actual.value: Not yet achieved - Audit procedure and methodology not aligned with INTOSAI Standards. SAI TA conducted two trainings which are theIPSAS Cash Base and the IFRs

title.narrative: FGS - Improved coverage and classification of data in in-year budget reports

baseline.value: Only approved budget and actuals disclosed

target.value: Timely In year budget reports include expenditure both at commitment and at payment stage

actual.value: Achieved - Allow comparison to approved budget including supplementary and virement

title.narrative: SOMALILAND - Improved coverage and classification of data in in-year budget reports

baseline.value: Only approved budget and actuals disclosed

target.value: Timely in-year budget reports included expenditure both at commitment and at payment stage

actual.value: In progress - Budget Department make Budget Calendar.The Budget department classify the Budget of 2018 by Recurrent Expenditureand Capital Expenditure or recurrent and development projects. The Budget Department together with Department of Macroeconomicand statistics Budget outlook paper is on process.The Budget Department is doing Revenue Forecast.
